etymology.description: 門(門) (mén, "gate") depicts a gate -> simplified to 门(门) (mén, "gate")
etymology.interpretation: The character 门(門) (mén, "gate") represents the image of a double-sided gate. It simplifies to 门(门) but retains the depiction of an entrance or gateway.
etymology.simplification: The character 门(门) is a simplified form of 門(門), where the complex structure is replaced by a more straightforward representation while preserving the overall image of a gate.

examples.chinese: 学校门前站着一位老师(學校門前站著一位老師)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào mén qián zhànzhe yī wèi lǎoshī(學校門前站著一位老師)。
examples.english: A teacher stands at the school gate.

examples.chinese: 请你从这扇门(請你從這扇門)进来(進來)，把鞋子(把鞋子)脱掉(脫掉)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ cóng zhè shàn mén(請你從這扇門) jìnlái(進來)，bǎ xiézi(把鞋子) tuōdiào(脫掉)。
examples.english: Please come in through this door and take off your shoes.

examples.chinese: 夜深了(夜深了)，只有微弱的光从门缝里泄出(只有微弱的光從門縫裡洩出)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn le(夜深了)，zhǐ yǒu wēiruò de guāng cóng mén fèng lǐ xiè chū(只有微弱的光從門縫裡洩出)。
examples.english: It's late at night, and only a faint light seeps through the gap in the door.
